TopicTitle: The Space Shuttle: A NASA Documentary

Articles.Content:
http://youtu.be/RC19StFeQ3k



A new documentary featuring the development process of NASA and how NASA did testing the Kerbal way, minus the crashes.
Is it really the Kerbal way if there are no crashes? Not if you're on my watch
We kill kerbals and try to save Jeb, lucky that Nasa is not like us! lol

Or try to make a space shuttle, fail and give up

But seriously, that is a fantastic documentary; perfect to remember the Space Shuttle and look forward to things to come!

I'm watching it right now, and I get shivers every two minutes

Edited April 29, 2013 by CalculusWarrior

Or try to make a space shuttle, fail and give up

I succeeded!
Great find - awesome documentary. Space stuff always gets me emotional
One of the most beautiful and dangerous vehicle ever created, simply awesome.

Nice find.

This should go in off-topic or Science labs tho.

I greatly dislike shuttles in KSP. I've build a few for fun, but they're really nothing special besides an interesting engineering challenge. This one I built using KW and the Mk. 3 expansion mod to give it some functionality.

At the same time, the benefits of the shuttle for NASA (moves crew about and cargo as well) don't really apply or exist in KSP, making them useless compared to dedicated one-off rockets (which cost nothing to develop but the price of a few Kerbals, and those guys are everywhere) or otherwise tested launch vehicles.

NASA video of the space shuttle with The Dark Knight soundtrack?

Perfect.

And who better to narrate this but James T. Kirk himself!!

It's late now, but I'm def going to watch this tomorrow. nice 1 for posting this.
